intro: Dupatya corymbosa, commonly known as the fragrant forest tree, is a species native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia. It is a deciduous tree that can grow up to 20 meters tall, characterized by its smooth, gray bark and lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, white flowers arranged in corymbs, which are followed by spherical, woody fruits containing numerous seeds. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in lowland forests and along riverbanks. The plant has been used traditionally for its aromatic properties and in local herbal medicine.
